page.title: 06ARMED FORCES
page.content: We know that in the l840's that at 'Camp Browndown',some German Militia were occupying the camp. They had lost their nationality by fighting for the British in the Napoleonic Wars some 25 years earlier. These mercenaries proved to be a headache to the authorities and in the end were married off in batches of twenty to the local ladies of Portsmouth! Between the l860's and 1890's the range was altered considerably, and the whole range was redesigned. All that is left today are two huge sea facing gun emplacements. The range is still a very popular training ground for all elements of the Armed Forces.It is also a S.S.I.
